content.description: Variation of Whoopdeedoo, combines Whoopdeedoo and Have Guns. Start in the back of the cave to the right, come out the horizontal crack, traverse the rail and finish on Whoopdeedoo.
content.location: Far right of the West Wall

content.description: On the center of the west wall there is an obvious weakness going up and over the cleft. Easier if you start right and traverse left under the roof, funner straight up and over.
content.location: The middle of the western facing wall.

content.description: The left hand bulge on the west facing wall. Starts on the outside of Have Guns Will Traverse. Pull the bulge, lockoff to slopers above, top it out.
content.location: The lower bulge on the west wall. Toprope can be set by slinging large trees above.

content.description: Just want the name implies, a good place to get your fingers warmed up. Many alternates and eliminates to play on.
content.protection: The ground. Unless you go high, in which case a pad or 2.
content.location: South facing block to the right of "Rivers".

content.description: This almost deserves an X rating, and if it is not cleaned on toprope, which is difficult to do, it is an X. The technical crux is getting your feet onto the first rail, the psychological crux is topping it out.
content.location: The arete just to the right of the Fist cracks.

content.description: A mossy low angle boulder good for a little fun. Many options for practicing foot work and slab.
content.location: South east facing face of boulder on the outside of Nemesis. Needs a brush.

content.description: Start sitting on the ground, hands on the small detached chockstone, pull into the 45ยบ overhung crack, make a move to the lip, pull up and over. Named for the amount of blood shed on the FA!
content.protection: 2+ pads, good spot. Bad landing during the dyno.
content.location: Find the large white overhung boulder with obvious diagonal cracks in the overhung face. There is a small flat rock in front of it. You need two pads and a good spot to protect.

content.description: A one move wonder boulder problem. Well, two move wonder. Sit start, figure out how to stand up and get to that good hold just out of reach. It's all about the balance. Starting on the ground, sans pad, V3. Sitting on a stacked pad, V1.
content.location: The large boulder at the base of the west wall. The north side, partially blocked by a tree, just past vertical. Top out, walk down.

content.description: The east facing wall on the uphill side of the crag. The wall was climbed first with snow on the ground and the moss covering all the holds. This is the way the FA's want it, as part of the 'charm' is discovering the hidden holds covered in wet moss.
content.protection: Toprope, which can be a little sketchy setting up.
content.location: The upper east facing wall, easily spotted by it being completely covered in moss. Please do not remove the moss.

content.description:
On the left hand side of the blank, vertical, (usually) moss coated wall, find a right hand mono and a left hand crimp. There is a right foot, if you want to call it that, and a smear for the left. Now blast for the top!

The crux is finding enough leverage for the dyno, and getting the edge above well enough to pull up on. Fun stuff.
content.location: The south aspect of the crag, to the left of the boulder chockstone.

content.description: Sit start, pull up on rail, grab thumb finger pinches with each hand (shallow pockets), get feet high, dyno to the pocket on the edge, move up to the better pocket, mantle. The top out can be a little dirty. OK, really really dirty.
content.location: Large white boulder, left side of face.

content.description: 5' to the right of Fist it is another dirty crack. It's either a rally easy boulder problem, a toprope, or lead it with a couple of hand/fist pieces.

Sit start on the inside of the large chockstone/hanging block, move underneath and onto the overhanging face, move up and left, without using the wall behind. The crux is moving off of the sloper to the rail with lousy feet.
content.location: Just to the right of the Nemesis wall.

content.description: The name says it. A long traverse, where the guns get worn. Starts in the horizontal roof, move out, up and left, traversing the bulge, then as far as one can to the left. Your feet are never more than 5' off the ground. Ends as the route gets higher, harder, more committing. Fun.
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter to move them as you traverse.
content.location: Find the west facing wall which butts into the new section of highway. At the bottom of this there is a cleft with a horizontal roof 6' off the ground. Go for it.

content.description: A fun line difficult to figure out. A lot of hand crosses, heel hooks, knee bars, etc, get you up to the crux. Can be bouldered without the toprope if you exit right after pulling the crux.
content.location: The south east arete of the area. Look for a slingtly overhung corner with a crack. Sit down and pull.

content.description: A short fist crack, either an unprotected boulder problem, a toprope, or a very short lead. Really not worth leading, but good practice for jamming hands and fists. Very dirty, as is everything up here.
content.location: Go under "Inside Out", and it is right there.

climbs.name: "Does This Thing Have A Name Yet?"

content.description: The right hand line on the Nemesis Wall. Using only the face, not the rock to the right, get your feet off the ground, and blast to the top. Usually dirty and in need of heavy cleaning.
